title: IT Assistant | Permanent Work from Home | Dayshift
company: All for One | CX Consulting & Services
job_desc:
Clear is looking for an IT Assistant to work with our corporate team and provide essential IT Support for our growing remote workforce.

Role and Opportunity

Your new role is to support IT operations, troubleshoot user issues, and guarantee a secure remote work environment. This is a fantastic opportunity for fresh graduates or early career IT professionals who want to gain hands-on experience in Microsoft 365 administration, Azure Active Directory, and endpoint security.

Purpose

As An IT Assistant, You Will

  • Manage and maintain Microsoft applications (e.g., Outlook, Teams, SharePoint, OneDrive)
  • Administer and troubleshoot Azure Active Directory and user access controls
  • Deploy, configure, and manage devices using Microsoft Intune for endpoint security and compliance
  • Provide support for Windows Operating System issues, updates, and security patches
  • Ensure a smooth and secure remote work environment through VPN, endpoint security, and IT best practices
  • Collaborate with teams to improve system performance, security, and IT efficiency

As An IT Assistant, Your Daily Tasks Include

  • Assist the IT Officer in managing IT requests via ticketing system, making sure urgent issues are addressed promptly
  • Provide remote support for IT-related concerns, keeping staff informed of lower-priority issues with clear timelines
  • Help establish remote access for client sites by coordinating with external providers
  • Assist in deploying equipment to new hires and coordinating with suppliers/vendors
  • Make certain all subscribed systems function optimally and provide user support as needed
  • Assist the IT Officer in retrieving company equipment from separated employees (resigned, dismissed, end of contract)
  • Provide IT services in the absence of the IT Officer as authorized and endorsed by the IT Officer or Management
  • Draft IT-related tips/reminders in an engaging and easy-to-understand format for IT Officer's approval
  • Perform other IT tasks as required by the immediate superior or management

Minimum Qualifications

  • Bachelor's degree in Information Technology, Computer Science, major in System Administration & Maintenance, Software & Hardware Maintenance or any closely related track focused on system support or IT infrastructure
  • At least 1-2 years of hands-on experience in IT Support, system administration, but fresh graduates are still welcome to apply
  • Proven experience with Microsoft 365 administration and troubleshooting
  • Strong knowledge of Azure Active Directory and user management but if a fresh graduate, understanding of Azure Active Directory and user access and authentication principles is acceptable
  • Hands-on experience with Microsoft Intune for device and policy management but if a fresh graduate, exposure to Microsoft Intune or other device management solutions from internships, academic projects, or certifications is acceptable
  • Experience in a Work from Home environment, with a solid understanding of remote work tools and security best practices

Required Attributes

  • Excellent verbal and written English communication skills
  • Positive and proactive mindset with a strong "can-do" attitude
  • Solution-oriented thinker who overcomes challenges without excuses
  • Self-motivated in handling tasks and responsibilities
  • Credible and dependable with a strong commitment to confidentiality
  • Excellent problem-solving skills and ability to work independently

title: Finance Admin Assistant
job_desc:
Company Description

Enderun Colleges is a prestigious undergraduate college offering bachelor's degree and non-degree courses in international hospitality management, business administration, entrepreneurship, and economics. The college has academic partnerships with Ducasse Education and Les Roches International School of Hotel Management, providing students with real-world experience through work internships both in the Philippines and abroad.


Role Description

The Finance Administrative Assistant plays a critical role in ensuring the smooth operation of financial and administrative tasks within the organization. This position supports operational efficiency by streamlining processes and ensuring smooth workflow through maintaining detailed and accurate financial records, centralized communication, cost monitoring, time management, and regulatory compliance.


Qualifications

  • Administrative Processes and Administrative Assistance skills
  • Billing Process and Invoicing skills
  • Finance knowledge and experience
  • Strong attention to detail and organizational skills
  • Strong leadership and problem-solving skills
  • Proficiency in MS Office applications
  • Experience in a financial or administrative role is a plus
  • Bachelor's degree in Accounting, Business, Finance or equivalent


Essential Functions:


Financial Record Keeping: Improve accuracy by managing and maintaining accurate financial records, including invoices, receipts, and financial reports.


Budget Management Support: Assists in budget preparation, tracking expenses, and ensuring expenditures align with the budget.


Processing Payments: Handles accounts payable and receivable, prepares invoices, and ensures timely payment processing.


Data Entry and Analysis: Enters financial data into systems and generates reports for analysis.


Compliance Assistance: Ensures adherence to financial regulations, company policies, and auditing requirements


Administrative Support: Schedules meetings, maintains calendars, and handles correspondence related to financial matters

title: Junior Project Manager
job_desc:
Global Junior Project Manager


Location: Manila

Shift: 7am-4pm, Mon-Fri

Arrangement: Hybrid

Unlock your potential!

We are seeking a motivated and detail-oriented Global Junior Project Manager to assist in planning, executing, and finalizing projects according to strict deadlines and within budget. This role involves coordinating team members, liaising with stakeholders, and ensuring project objectives are met. The ideal candidate is highly organized, an excellent communicator, and eager to grow within project management. Additionally, this role will involve data analytics to support project tracking, decision-making, and reporting.


Responsibilities

+ Assist in the development of project plans, including scope, schedule, and resource allocation.

+ Monitor project progress and provide updates to senior project managers and stakeholders.

+ Coordinate communication between project teams, ensuring alignment on objectives and deliverables.

+ Identify and address potential risks, proposing solutions to mitigate challenges.

+ Assist in maintaining project documentation, including reports, schedules, and meeting notes.

+ Support budgeting and cost tracking to ensure financial efficiency.

+ Ensure projects comply with internal policies and industry best practices.

+ Facilitate team meetings, taking minutes and tracking action items to completion.

+ Utilize project management tools to track progress and manage tasks effectively.

+ Leverage data analytics to track key performance indicators (KPIs), generate reports, and improve project efficiency.

+ Analyze project data to identify trends, risks, and opportunities for optimization.

+ Assist in automating data collection and reporting for improved decision-making.

+ Utilize Microsoft tools such as Excel, Power BI, SharePoint, Teams, and Microsoft Project to streamline project management and

enhance collaboration.


Key Qualifications/Experience

+ Bachelor's degree in business administration, Project Management, Data Analytics, or a related field.

+ 1-2 years of experience in project management or a similar role (internships included).

+ Strong organizational and multitasking skills with attention to detail.

+ Effective communication and interpersonal skills.

+ Proficiency in project management software (e.g., Smartsheet, Trello, Asana, MS Project, Jira).

+ Basic understanding of project management methodologies (Agile, Waterfall, etc.).

+ Ability to work collaboratively and adapt to fast-paced environments.

+ Problem-solving mindset with a proactive approach to challenges.

+ Experience with data analytics tools such as Excel, Power BI, or Tableau.

+ Ability to interpret and visualize data to support project decision-making.

+ Proficient in Microsoft tools such as Excel, Power BI, SharePoint, Teams, and Microsoft Project.

+ Project Management certification (CLSSWB, CSM, CAPM, PRINCE2 Foundation, or equivalent) is a plus.

+ Experience working in an Agile environment and BCP

+ Familiarity with risk management and budgeting principles.

+ Knowledge of SQL or Python for data analysis is a plus.


What’s in it for you?

  • A competitive salary
  • Health Insurance, and Life Insurance coverage
  • 21 annual paid leaves
  • Annual increase (Annual Performance Review)
  • Tenure Recognition Program
  • Access to certifications and courses from Ab2 Institute of Accounting
  • 20+ options of free coffee and chocolate drinks
  • Billiards, table tennis, or foosball in our breakout room
  • Work-life balance and logging off on time for you to enjoy more personal time.
  • A genuinely diverse, caring, supportive and high achieving team environment.
  • Ongoing training, development and career progression opportunities



We live by our VALUES to cultivate and foster growth and innovation.

BE AWESOME: Exceptional individuals create collective genius. We celebrate success, reward outstanding performance, and make work fun by fostering a supportive and inspiring environment.

KEEP IT REAL: We value honesty, accountability, and open communication. We own our actions, prioritize compassion, empathy, and understanding, and foster meaningful conversations.

BRING THE WOW: We strive for excellence in everything we do. Going the extra mile is our standard, as we are committed to delivering outstanding results.

DREAM BIG: We embrace a culture of continuous learning, exploration, and improvement. With ambitious goals, we constantly seek knowledge and self-improvement.


Visit us at: https://careers.toaglobal.com/


Join TOA Global and experience the difference!


We passionately embrace diversity and inclusion in all aspects of our organization. We believe by fostering an environment that values and celebrates individuals from diverse backgrounds, we unlock innovation, drive creativity, and amplify our ability to serve our customers and communities with excellence.

title: Business Development Analyst
job_desc:
Responsibilities:

  • Conduct thorough market research to identify industry trends, competitor activities, and potential new markets.
  • Analyze market data and generate reports to provide insights and recommendations for business development strategies.
  • Track and analyze key performance indicators (KPIs) to evaluate the effectiveness of business development initiatives.
  • Identify and evaluate potential business opportunities, including partnerships, acquisitions, and new product/service offerings.
  • Develop financial models and business cases to assess the viability and profitability of potential opportunities.
  • Prepare presentations and reports to communicate findings and recommendations to senior management.
  • Support the development and implementation of strategic business development plans.
  • Assist in the creation of proposals, presentations, and other materials for potential clients and partners.
  • Collaborate with cross-functional teams (e.g., sales, marketing, product development) to support business development initiatives.
  • Maintain accurate records of business development activities and progress.
  • Assist in building and maintaining relationships with potential clients, partners, and industry stakeholders.
  • Develop visually appealing content for various platforms, including infographics, social media posts, and presentations. Basic graphic design skills and experience with Canva or similar tools are required
  • Develop clear and concise technical documentation with accompanying diagrams and illustrations. Basic graphic design skills and experience with diagramming tools (e.g., Visio, Lucidchart) are a plus.


Qualifications:

  • Bachelor's degree in Business Administration, Finance, Marketing, or a related field.
  • Fresh graduates are welcome, preferred are with at least 6 months to 1 year of experience in business development, market research, or a related field (or relevant internships).
  • Strong analytical and problem-solving skills.
  • Excellent written and verbal communication skills.
  • Proficiency in Microsoft Office Suite (Excel, PowerPoint, Word).
  • Ability to work independently and as part of a team.
  • Strong organizational and time management skills.
  • Ability to prioritize and manage multiple tasks simultaneously.


Preferred Skills:

  • Experience with CRM software (e.g., Salesforce, HubSpot).
  • Financial modeling and analysis experience.
  • Knowledge of data visualization tools (e.g., Tableau, Power BI).
  • Experience with [Specific Tools or Software Relevant to the Industry].

title: Business Development Executive (Cavite)
job_desc:
“To be the most loved everyday food and groceries destination!” - that’s our mission at foodpanda (small ‘f’).


foodpanda is the largest food and grocery delivery platform in Asia, outside of China. Operating in more than 400 cities across 11 markets, we continue to expand and grow in our core food delivery business, as well as in new verticals like grocery deliveries, with a strong tech infrastructure at our core. From our restaurants-partners, cloud kitchens and cloud grocery stores — foodpanda is just one tap away, getting everything you need into your hands quickly and conveniently!


If you love working with technology to create solutions and are not afraid to roll up your sleeves to get things done, you will find your tribe here at foodpanda. foodpanda comprises of people from more than 60 nationalities, and we believe in winning through diversity.

foodpanda is part of the Delivery Hero Group, the world’s leading local delivery platform operating in 70+ countries worldwide


About The Opportunity

  • You will be part of our company’s growth by acquiring new businesses to partner with us
  • You will effectively and efficiently exhaust leads and close deals with target partners by cold calling, fieldwork, virtual presentations, etc.
  • Effectively and creatively present foodpanda’s packages to potential partners.
  • Work closely with other departments to make sure we have a successful vendor incubation.
  • Be the local representative in the area: monitor competitor activities, gather feedback, and provide recommendations to ensure a healthy market share.


What you need to be successful

  • Graduate of a Bachelor's degree in business, marketing, mass communication, or related areas are preferred
  • Open for fresh graduates with sales experience gained through internships, but candidates with 2-3 years sales and/or business development experience and strong understanding of Sales Pipeline Management will be prioritized
  • Strong communication skills. Preferably comfortable to speak in both English, Filipino, and in the local dialect in the area.
  • Open to do extensive fieldwork.
  • Highly motivated to achieve targets, objectives, and key result areas.
  • Self motivated team player with a proven ability work in a fast paced environment

title: 2025 Summer Internship - Advisory Analysis Intern
job_desc:
Why Nasdaq?

You may think of Nasdaq as just a stock exchange but think again. We are a global technology company championing inclusive growth and prosperity. We are committed to our employees' career growth and offer unparalleled support as you work with others to create equitable opportunities and prosperity worldwide.

We work hard to make sure everyone here is successful together. Diversity is at the core of what we do, and we deliberately seek out people who bring unique backgrounds, skills, and perspectives to our culture. 

Be part of our Global Internship Program

The Nasdaq Internship Program in Manila provides students with outstanding opportunities through an immersive 10 weeks of internship from June to August 2025. We offer internships across fields, like advisory services, investment intelligence, business and analytics and many more.

We believe in learning by doing, that’s why our Interns gain hands-on experience working on complex projects that create business impact. You will work alongside your senior Nasdaq teammates and work across departments. You will acquire new skills, get invaluable network of connections, and join fun social hours where all Global Interns connect. We strive for a diverse and fun workplace, where all of us—that includes you—feel like the work we do makes a difference.

We will invest in your growth through mentorship and learning and development programs designed to enhance your personal and professional skills. Career growth and acceleration are core to Nasdaq’s culture. We offer you with the opportunity to stay beyond internship by joining the team after graduating from college or finishing your master’s degree.

Visit Nasdaq Internship page to learn more about our program for students and our previous interns’ experiences.

Your Role:

As Advisory Analysis Intern, you will learn about the daily duties of an Advisory Analyst. You will be receiving training throughout your internship and be expected to assist and support our analysts with the following operational activities:

  • Processing information gathered through disclosure responses and shareholder data sources by entering these data into Nasdaq's proprietary database as stated in the process methodology and by adhering to all quality checklists in place.
  • Researching, analyzing, and validating relevant ownership data from data sources to ensure accuracy of information and completeness of the report.
  • Generating reports and summarizing key movements and trends in the shareholder base by following standard procedure on data integrity, accuracy, and in compliance to client specifications and ensuring timely delivery to client and counterparts.
  • Writing insightful commentaries and analysis of shareholder.
  • Working with global counterparts in completing client deliverables/reports consistent with the quality that clients expect and proactively providing counterpart progress updates in relation to the status of clients assigned.
  • Raising critical issues to manager or team lead that affects report delivery and client satisfaction.
  • Working with Managers/Team Leads/Senior Analysts and Specialists in the implementation of data quality, process efficiency and productivity improvement initiatives.
  • Collaborating and performing specific tasks for different Manila Advisory Services teams and other Business Units to help increase overall efficiency and productivity.
  • Engage with global colleagues to share knowledge across geographic teams.

Who we are looking for:

  • Passionate individual looking to start their career in a technology company.
  • Penultimate students who are taking courses Business Administration or Management, Economics, Finance, Financial Institution, or any related courses.
  • A passionate individual who is knowledgeable in research, analysis, managing data, finance, and communications.
  • A critical thinker, well-informed and has understanding of any of the following would be an advantage: Investor Relations, Shareholder and Financial Analysis.
  • Able to communicate effectively and has proficient skills in different Microsoft tools especially Excel and can use different functions including VBA.
  • A self-starter with evidence of intellectual curiosity and problem-solving abilities.

This is a full-time, paid internship based in our office in BGC, Metro Manila, Philippines.

Come as You Are

Nasdaq is an equal opportunity employer. We positively encourage applications from suitably qualified and eligible candidates regardless of age, color, disability, national origin, ancestry, race, religion, gender, sexual orientation, gender identity and/or expression, veteran status, genetic information, or any other status protected by applicable law.

We will ensure that individuals with disabilities are provided reasonable accommodation to participate in the job application or interview process, to perform essential job functions, and to receive other benefits and privileges of employment. Please contact us to request an accommodation.

title: Partnerships Intern
job_desc:
PayMongo is the Philippines’ leading financial operating system, enabling businesses to accept payments, manage finances, and scale effortlessly. Over the next few years, we aim to redefine the financial landscape with innovative solutions that simplify and empower business growth.

PayMongo is looking for a Partnerships Intern to support our growing network of financial institutions and technology partners. This is a great opportunity to gain hands-on experience in the fintech industry, working alongside cross-functional teams to help scale PayMongo’s partner ecosystem and optimize operational workflows.

As a Partnerships Intern, you will assist in:

  • Partnership Support: Assist in managing relationships with key financial partners, including banks, e-wallet providers, and payment networks. Support the tracking and execution of partner agreements and operational workflows.Coordinate with internal teams to ensure smooth partner interactions
  • Business Development Assistance: Help identify potential partnership opportunities through market research and outreach. Assist in preparing presentations, reports, and proposals for partners. Support partner onboarding and engagement initiatives
  • Analytics & Operations: Monitor and analyze partnership performance metrics to provide insights. Document best practices and help standardize processes for partner management. Assist in resolving partner inquiries by coordinating with relevant teams


You may be a fit if:

  • You are a motivated and detail oriented intern who is eager to learn about partnerships and fintech
  • Strong analytical and problem solving skills
  • Excellent communication and interpersonal skills
  • Ability to manage multiple tasks and work in a fast paced environment
  • Passion for technology and financial services
  • Experience in business development, partnerships, or operations (through coursework, projects, or other internships)
  • Familiarity with productivity tools (Google Suite, ClickUp, Notion)
  • Interest in fintech, payments, or digital finance


PayMongo is a financial technology company empowering businesses to scale and thrive with powerful financial tools. We started the company in March 2019, and we are backed by Silicon Valley's most forward-thinking investors including Y Combinator, Peter Thiel, Founders Fund and Stripe. We are looking for people with passion, grit and the integrity to help us build the future of payments.

job_desc:

title: Events Marketing Specialist
job_desc:
About TaskUs: TaskUs is a provider of outsourced digital services and next-generation customer experience to fast-growing technology companies, helping its clients represent, protect and grow their brands. Leveraging a cloud-based infrastructure, TaskUs serves clients in the fastest-growing sectors, including social media, e-commerce, gaming, streaming media, food delivery, ride-sharing, HiTech, FinTech, and HealthTech.

The People First culture at TaskUs has enabled the company to expand its workforce to approximately 45,000 employees globally. Presently, we have a presence in twenty-three locations across twelve countries, which include the Philippines, India, and the United States.

It started with one ridiculously good idea to create a different breed of Business Processing Outsourcing (BPO)! We at TaskUs understand that achieving growth for our partners requires a culture of constant motion, exploring new technologies, being ready to handle any challenge at a moment's notice, and mastering consistency in an ever-changing world.

What We Offer: At TaskUs, we prioritize our employees' well-being by offering competitive industry salaries and comprehensive benefits packages. Our commitment to a People First culture is reflected in the various departments we have established, including Total Rewards, Wellness, HR, and Diversity. We take pride in our inclusive environment and positive impact on the community. Moreover, we actively encourage internal mobility and professional growth at all stages of an employee's career within TaskUs. Join our team today and experience firsthand our dedication to supporting People First.

What can you expect in an Events Marketing Specialist role with TaskUs:

As a Marketing Specialist- Events, you will play a key role in supporting the planning and execution of events that enhance brand awareness and engagement. You will collaborate closely with internal teams and vendors to ensure seamless experiences that reflect our company's values and vision. If you're eager to learn, highly organized, and passionate about events, we want to hear from you!

Key Responsibilities:

  • Event Coordination:


Assist in planning and executing events, including conferences, client meetings, internal engagements, and webinars.

Support logistics, vendor coordination, and on-site execution to ensure smooth operations.

  • Creativity & Innovation:


Contribute fresh ideas to enhance event themes, branding, and attendee experiences.

Stay updated on industry trends to help bring creative elements to each event.

  • Stakeholder Collaboration:


Work with cross-functional teams, including marketing, sales, and HR, to align events with business objectives.

Assist in collecting and incorporating stakeholder feedback into event planning.

  • Budget & Resource Management:


Help track event budgets and support cost-effective planning.

Coordinate vendor payments and assist in contract negotiations.

  • Post-Event Analysis:


Gather attendee feedback and help assess event success.

Compile reports on event performance and key takeaways for continuous improvement.

Required Qualifications:

  • Experience in event planning, marketing, or related fields (internships or academic projects are a plus).
  • Strong organizational and time management skills.
  • Creative mindset with attention to detail.
  • Excellent communication and teamwork abilities.
  • Ability to manage multiple tasks in a fast-paced environment.
  • Basic knowledge of event logistics and marketing principles.
  • Ability to manage multiple projects simultaneously in a fast-paced environment.


How We Partner To Protect You: TaskUs will neither solicit money from you during your application process nor require any form of payment in order to proceed with your application. Kindly ensure that you are always in communication with only authorized recruiters of TaskUs.

DEI: In TaskUs we believe that innovation and higher performance are brought by people from all walks of life. We welcome applicants of different backgrounds, demographics, and circumstances. Inclusive and equitable practices are our responsibility as a business. TaskUs is committed to providing equal access to opportunities. If you need reasonable accommodations in any part of the hiring process, please let us know.

We invite you to explore all TaskUs career opportunities and apply through the provided URL https://www.taskus.com/careers/ .

title: Supply Chain and Documentation Specialist
job_desc:
The Supply Chain & Documentation Specialist will be directly responsible for managing and optimizing supply chain activities while ensuring accurate and efficient handling of documentation processes. Reporting directly to management, the role requires a highly motivated individual who can independently oversee procurement, logistics, inventory, and compliance documentation, contributing to strategic decision-making and operational efficiency.

Key Responsibilities

Supply Chain Coordination:

  • Plan, coordinate, and monitor supply chain operations to ensure the efficient flow of goods and services.
  • Liaise with suppliers, vendors, transporters, and internal teams to manage procurement, shipping, and delivery schedules.
  • Track inventory levels, oversee stock movement, and maintain accurate inventory records.
  • Optimize logistics processes to reduce costs, improve efficiency, and meet operational targets.
  • Provide regular updates to management regarding supply chain performance and operational bottlenecks.

Documentation Management

  • Prepare, review, and manage all required shipping and compliance documents, including invoices, bills of lading, packing lists, and certificates of origin.
  • Ensure accuracy and completeness of documentation to meet regulatory and legal requirements.
  • Maintain organized records of all supply chain transactions and documentation for audit and reporting purposes.
  • Coordinate with customs brokers, freight forwarders, and regulatory agencies to ensure smooth import/export operations.

Compliance And Risk Management

  • Ensure adherence to local trade regulations and company policies.
  • Monitor supply chain risks and implement corrective actions to minimize disruptions.
  • Regularly review and improve documentation processes to ensure compliance and accuracy.

Reporting And Strategic Input

  • Directly report to management on supply chain performance, documentation accuracy, and operational challenges.
  • Prepare and present periodic performance reports, including KPIs, cost analyses, and recommendations for process improvements.
  • Provide insights to assist management in strategic decision-making regarding supply chain optimization and compliance strategies.

Stakeholder Collaboration

  • Work closely with the finance department to reconcile invoices and manage payment processing.
  • Collaborate with internal teams to align supply chain activities with business objectives.
  • Act as the primary point of contact for documentation and logistics-related inquiries and issues.

Qualifications

  • Education:
  • Bachelor’s degree in Supply Chain Management, Industrial Engineering, Logistics, Business Administration, or a related field.
  • Fresh graduates with relevant coursework or internships are welcome to apply.
  • Experience: Preferably 1-2 years of experience in supply chain and documentation management, but highly capable fresh graduates will also be considered.
  • Technical Skills:
  • Proficient in MS Office (Excel, Word, PowerPoint).
  • Familiarity with ERP systems (e.g., SAP, Odoo, or similar platforms) is an advantage.
  • Soft Skills:
  • Strong organizational, problem-solving, and communication skills.
  • Ability to multitask, work under pressure, and meet deadlines with minimal supervision.

Competencies

  • Strong understanding of supply chain processes and logistics management.
  • High attention to detail and accuracy in documentation handling.
  • Familiarity with international shipping procedures and trade regulations.
  • Proactive, analytical, and able to provide strategic insights.
  • Ability to work directly with management and effectively communicate operational updates.

Work Environment

  • Office-based with occasional site visits or travel as required.
  • Collaborative yet independent environment with a direct line to management.

title: Business Development Executive (Key Accounts)
job_desc:
About The Opportunity

  • You will be part of our company’s growth by acquiring new businesses to partner with us
  • You will effectively and efficiently exhaust leads and close deals with target partners by cold calling, fieldwork, virtual presentations, etc.
  • Effectively and creatively present foodpanda’s packages to potential partners.
  • Work closely with other departments to make sure we have a successful vendor incubation.
  • Be the local representative in the area: monitor competitor activities, gather feedback, and provide recommendations to ensure a healthy market share.

What You Need To Be Successful

  • Graduate of a Bachelor's degree in business, marketing, mass communication, or related areas are preferred
  • Open for fresh graduates with sales experience gained through internships, but candidates with 2-3 years sales and/or business development experience and strong understanding of Sales Pipeline Management will be prioritized
  • Strong communication skills. Preferably comfortable to speak in both English, Filipino, and in the local dialect in the area.
  • Open to do extensive fieldwork.
  • Highly motivated to achieve targets, objectives, and key result areas.
  • Self motivated team player with a proven ability work in a fast paced environment

Who We Are

foodpanda is part of the Delivery Hero Group, the world’s pioneering local delivery platform, our mission is to deliver an amazing experience—fast, easy, and to your door. We operate in over 70+ countries worldwide. Headquartered in Berlin, Germany. Delivery Hero has been listed on the Frankfurt Stock Exchange since 2017 and is part of the MDAX stock market index.

What's In It For You

What we offer

  • A dynamic and challenging work environment.
  • A company committed to developing you personally and professionally.
  • A great working atmosphere with regular company and team events.
  • A vibrant and international team committed to diversity and inclusion.
  • Responsibility from day one in a fast growing and global company.
  • Other benefits include free food, health and dental insurance, and learning and development opportunities!

foodpanda is operated by Delivery Hero Group (“DH Group”) - the world’s leading local delivery platform, operating in 70+ markets across Asia, Europe, Latin America, the Middle East, and Africa. Delivery Hero started as a food delivery service in 2011 and now employs 40,000+ people globally. Additionally, Delivery Hero is pioneering quick commerce, the next generation of e-commerce, aiming to bring groceries and household goods to customers in under one hour and often in 20 to 30 minutes. Headquartered in Berlin, Germany, Delivery Hero has been listed on the Frankfurt Stock Exchange since 2017 and is part of the MDAX stock market index

You will work alongside your senior Nasdaq teammates and work across departments. You will acquire new skills, get invaluable network of connections, and join fun social hours where all Global Interns connect. We strive for a diverse and fun workplace, where all of us—that includes you—feel like the work we do makes a difference.

We will invest in your growth through mentorship and learning and development programs designed to enhance your personal and professional skills. Career growth and acceleration are core to Nasdaq’s culture. We offer you with the opportunity to stay beyond internship by joining the team after graduating from college or finishing your master’s degree.

Visit Nasdaq Internship page to learn more about our program for students and our previous interns’ experiences.

Your Role:

As a Knowledge Management Intern for People Services, you will undergo training and familiarization on the fundamentals of knowledge management and its application in the workplace. Knowledge management includes content development, system management, client management, and strategic planning.

In this role, you will be providing support and assistance to the Knowledge Management Specialist in expanding and improving the governance within the current knowledge management system.

Who we are looking for:

  • Passionate individual looking to start their career in a technology company.
  • Penultimate students who are taking courses Business Administration or Managament, Human Resources, Communication, or any related courses.
  • A critical thinker, well-informed and has understanding of basic Knowledge Management would be an advantage.
  • A passionate individual with experience or background in technical documentation and process mapping.
  • A self-starter and has good communication skills.

This is a full-time, paid internship based in our office in BGC, Metro Manila, Philippines.

Come as You Are

Nasdaq is an equal opportunity employer. We positively encourage applications from suitably qualified and eligible candidates regardless of age, color, disability, national origin, ancestry, race, religion, gender, sexual orientation, gender identity and/or expression, veteran status, genetic information, or any other status protected by applicable law.

We will ensure that individuals with disabilities are provided reasonable accommodation to participate in the job application or interview process, to perform essential job functions, and to receive other benefits and privileges of employment. Please contact us to request an accommodation.

title: Junior Infrastructure Engineer
job_desc:
Media Meter Inc. is looking for an enthusiastic and adaptable Junior Infrastructure Engineer to support the maintenance, monitoring, and enhancement of our IT systems and networks. As a Junior Infrastructure Specialist, you will work alongside experienced professionals to ensure the performance, security, and reliability of our IT systems while learning about the latest technologies and practices in the industry.

Key Responsibilities

  • Infrastructure Maintenance: Assist in monitoring, troubleshooting, and maintaining hardware, servers, and networks to ensure optimal performance and reliability.
  • System Support: Provide support for infrastructure-related incidents, escalating issues to senior specialists and teams as necessary.
  • Network Management: Support the configuration, maintenance, and monitoring of network devices, including routers, switches, and firewalls.
  • Data Security: Assist in implementing security measures to protect systems and data, including routine updates, patches, and backups.
  • Documentation: Maintain accurate records of configurations, processes, and incidents to ensure consistent and clear documentation.
  • Collaboration: Work closely with cross-functional teams to support infrastructure projects and resolve IT issues.
  • Learning and Development: Stay up-to-date on emerging infrastructure technologies and participate in training sessions as needed.

Qualifications

Minimum Qualifications:

Education

  • Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, Computer Engineering, Information Technology, or a related field (or equivalent experience).

Experience

  • Open to fresh graduates and candidates with up to 2 years of experience in IT infrastructure, system administration, or a similar role.
  • Relevant internships or academic projects are considered an advantage.

Skills And Competencies

  • Basic understanding of IT infrastructure components (servers, storage, networks, etc.).
  • Familiarity with operating systems such as Windows Server and Linux.
  • Knowledge of networking concepts, including TCP/IP, DNS, and VPN.
  • Exposure to cloud platforms like AWS, Azure, or Google Cloud is a plus.
  • Basic scripting or programming experience (e.g., PowerShell, Python) is desirable.
  • Strong problem-solving and analytical skills.
  • Excellent communication and teamwork abilities.
  • Ability to manage multiple tasks and prioritize effectively in a fast-paced environment.
  • Eagerness to learn and adapt to new technologies and challenges.

title: Financial Research & Intelligence Associate
job_desc:
About Lennor Group

As a proud Filipino company, we are committed to providing world-class business and workforce solutions. Our deep market expertise, combined with a global perspective, empowers us to serve businesses of all sizes and industries efficiently

Our brand, Lennor Metier, is a leading recruitment agency and headhunting firm in the Philippines, partnering with reputable companies to source top talent for direct-hire opportunities. It specializes in IT, Finance, Engineering, Sales & Marketing, Supply Chain, HR, and Executive Search.

Industry: Business Consulting & Services

Salary Range: Open to Negotiation

Work Setup: Remote

Shift Schedule: Mid Shift

Location: Remote

Job Overview

As a Financial Research & Intelligence Associate, you will play a crucial role in building a research & intelligence team in the Philippines for our client, consisting of research analysts developing meaningful insights of public and private software and tech companies, market insights & trends, and investing execution. The job offer is a very strong fit for people who already have successful experiences in Strategy Consulting, Private Equity, Investment Banking or Venture Capital and are up to the challenge of nurturing junior members who can perform research analysis.

Your Responsibilities

  • Conduct deep fundamental research on software & technology companies
  • Perform strategic due diligence and financial analysis on publicly listed and privately owned software & technology companies
  • Leverage both quantitative modelling and qualitative insights generation through expert interviews
  • Collaborate with a strong team of peers and experienced ex-Tier 1 management consultants contributing to the research
  • Deliver high quality and valuable deliverables that will support decision making on multi-million investments
  • Communicate your research findings internally and externally
  • Daily monitoring of the already identified companies
  • Prepare financial research and analysis, strategic screening and communicate materials for our members
  • Lead interviews in English with professional experts
  • Contribute to process improvement and new companies screening
  • Help identify top talents and build the research team based in the Philippines

What Our Client Is Looking For

  • You are an engineering / business school graduate specialized in strategy/corporate finance/investment/engineering
  • You have relevant 1-3 years of experiences in management consulting, strategic consulting, and finance (with several internships in finance/tech/startup or corporate company)
  • You have excellent analyst skills and a strong strategic thinking mind - you know how to look for key inputs and do smart correlations
  • You have strong oral and written communication skills
  • You have an interest in leading and joining a start-up company

Ready to take the next step in your career? Submit your application now!

  • We kindly request your patience as we receive a significant number of applications. Rest assured that our team will update your application's status soon. In the meantime, we encourage you to follow our LinkedIn page to stay informed about future opportunities and company updates.

title: Marketing Assistant - (ZR_21451_JOB)
job_desc:
This is a remote position.

Schedule: 20 hours/week, Monday-Friday 12:00PM-4:00PM PDT

Job Title: Marketing Assistant

A Marketing Assistant plays a key role in supporting the marketing team by assisting with a range of tasks, including market research, content creation, social media management, event coordination, and administrative support. The position is designed to contribute to the overall marketing strategy and ensure the smooth execution of campaigns.

Key Responsibilities

  • Market Research and Analysis:
  • Assist in identifying target markets and understanding customer behaviors.
  • Conduct market research to gather insights that inform marketing strategies.
  • Analyze competitor activities and identify potential opportunities for growth.
  • Content Creation and Management:
  • Create compelling and engaging content for various marketing channels such as social media, email, and websites.
  • Assist in the development and implementation of content calendars.
  • Manage and regularly update social media platforms.
  • Event Coordination:
  • Support the planning and execution of marketing events, trade shows, and promotional activities.
  • Coordinate event logistics, prepare promotional materials, and liaise with vendors to ensure smooth operations.
  • Administrative Support:
  • Provide general administrative assistance to the marketing team.
  • Manage team calendars, schedule meetings, and handle correspondence.
  • Prepare reports, presentations, and other necessary documentation.
  • Campaign Execution:
  • Assist in the development and execution of marketing campaigns.
  • Monitor campaign performance, analyze results, and provide insights.
  • Suggest improvements to optimize ongoing and future campaigns.

Skills And Qualifications

  • Strong Communication Skills: Excellent written and verbal communication abilities are crucial for effective collaboration with team members, clients, and external partners.
  • Organizational Skills: Strong ability to manage multiple tasks, prioritize projects, and meet deadlines in a fast-paced environment.
  • Analytical Skills: Ability to analyze data, identify trends, and make informed decisions based on insights.
  • Creativity: Ability to think creatively and contribute innovative ideas for content and campaigns.
  • Proficiency in Marketing Tools: Familiarity with social media platforms, email marketing software, and other marketing tools is essential.
  • Basic Understanding of Marketing Principles: Knowledge of marketing strategies, concepts, and best practices.
  • Education: A high school diploma or equivalent is required; a bachelor’s degree in marketing, communications, or a related field is a plus.
  • Experience: While this is an entry-level role, prior experience through internships or relevant work is a bonus.

Independent Contractor Perks

  • Permanent work from home
  • Immediate hiring
  • Steady freelance job

ZR_21451_JOB

title: Marketing Assistant
job_desc:
Are you a passionate, intelligent, and driven marketer eager to launch and build a successful career in marketing? Do you thrive in a fast-paced environment, possess a natural curiosity for understanding audiences, and are you brimming with creative ideas? We're looking for an enthusiastic Marketing Assistant to join our dynamic team and contribute to our marketing efforts.


This is an exceptional opportunity for a motivated individual to gain hands-on experience across various marketing disciplines, learn from experienced professionals, and make a tangible impact on our brand growth. You will be an integral part of our marketing team, supporting the execution of marketing strategies and contributing to the overall success of our campaigns.


Who are we?

We're hellobrandshop.com and we help businesses grow. We believe in the transformative power of bold ideas, and unlocking the potential within every one of us.


We're not just marketers; we are architects of growth. We delve deep, understanding the unique soul of each business. We champion innovative solutions that resonate with human needs and build lasting connections. We are driven by a relentless pursuit of impact, ensuring every campaign delivers meaningful results that move the needle.


We're human-centred, innovation-driven and impact focused. We prioritise people – our people, our clients and their customers. We embrace creativity and challenge the status quo, constantly exploring new avenues for growth. We measure success not just by metrics, but by the positive change we create in the world.

Let's build a brighter future together.


What we offer


  • A fantastic opportunity to kickstart and grow your marketing career within a supportive and dynamic environment.
  • Hands-on experience across a variety of marketing functions.
  • Mentorship and guidance from experienced marketing professionals.
  • Opportunities for professional development and training.
  • A collaborative and inclusive company culture.


The Role


Campaign Support

  • Assist in the planning, execution, and optimization of marketing campaigns across various channels, including digital, social media and email.
  • Coordinate campaign logistics, such as scheduling, content creation, asset management, and distribution, to ensure timely and effective campaign delivery.
  • Monitor campaign performance metrics, analyze data, and provide insights and recommendations for optimization and improvement.


Content Creation and Management

  • Create and curate content for marketing materials, including blog posts, social media posts, emails, websites, and promotional materials.
  • Assist in content development processes, such as writing copy, designing graphics, editing videos, and updating web pages, to align with brand guidelines and messaging.
  • Maintain content calendars and schedules, to organize and manage marketing assets effectively.


Digital Marketing Support

  • Assist in the management of digital marketing channels, including website updates, social media management, email marketing campaigns, and online advertising.
  • Monitor social media channels, respond to comments, engage with followers, and track social media metrics to build brand awareness and engagement.
  • Support SEO efforts by optimizing website content, conducting keyword research, and implementing on-page and off-page optimization tactics.


Administrative and Coordination Tasks

  • Ad hoc administration tasks to assist with the growth of brandshop.com.au and associated businesses
About you


  • Completed or in-progress Bachelor’s degree in Marketing, Communications, Business Administration, or related field preferred; relevant coursework or internship experience may be considered.
  • Strong written and verbal communication skills, with the ability to create compelling content and effectively communicate ideas to internal and external stakeholders.
  • Proficiency in Google Docs or Microsoft Office Suite (Word, Excel, PowerPoint) and familiarity with marketing tools and platforms, such as Google Analytics, Hootsuite, Mailchimp, or HubSpot.
  • Basic understanding of marketing principles, concepts, and tactics, with a willingness to learn and develop new skills in digital marketing, content creation, and campaign management.
  • Detail-oriented with strong organizational and time-management skills, capable of managing multiple tasks and priorities in a fast-paced environment.
  • Collaborative team player with a positive attitude, adaptable nature, and willingness to support team members and contribute to team goals.
  • Ability to work independently, take initiative, and problem-solve creatively, while also following direction and adhering to deadlines and guidelines.
  • Previous experience in marketing, advertising, or related fields through internships, part-time roles, or extracurricular activities is advantageous.
  • Passion for marketing, creativity, and innovation, with a desire to grow and develop a career in the field of marketing and communications.

title: Technical Business Analyst Position
job_desc:
Axos Business Center, Corp

About This Job

Axos Clearing is seeking a Technical Business Systems Analyst (TBA) with expertise in system analysis of software programs, applications, and web services. This role bridges business requirements and technical delivery, ensuring that product development aligns with Axos Clearing's strategic objectives in financial services. The ideal candidate will work closely with Product, Development, and Architecture teams to define, document, and refine technical solutions, supporting a microservices-based architecture and seamless system integration.

Responsibilities

  • Collaborate with stakeholders, including the Architecture Team, to document high-level technical specifications and Proof of Concepts (POCs).
  • Work closely with Product BAs to define and document both technical and non-functional requirements.
  • Translate business requirements into user stories and detailed documentation for technical implementation by development teams.
  • Partner with the Software Development Manager and Technical Leads to develop low-level documentation.
  • Serve as a Subject Matter Expert (SME) on specific software systems, providing technical insights to support effective project delivery.
  • Support all phases of the Software Development Lifecycle (SDLC), including requirements gathering, testing, deployment, and production support.
  • Maintain organized and up-to-date documentation to ensure technical alignment with system changes.
  • Communicate effectively across teams to foster consistent information sharing and collaboration.
  • Demonstrate strong organizational, analytical, and problem-solving skills, working independently and as part of cross-functional teams.

Requirments:

  • Bachelor's degree in financial management, engineering, computer science, or a related field.
  • 3+ years of experience in technical business analysis, ideally in financial services, securities trading, clearing and settlement, or digital banking.
  • Experience with system analysis of software applications, programs, or web services.
  • Proficiency in the Agile/SCRUM framework, with experience in writing user stories and technical documentation.
  • Hands-on experience across SDLC phases, including requirements gathering, testing, and deployment.
  • Strong written, verbal, and email communication skills, with upper-intermediate English proficiency.
  • Independent, detail-oriented, and highly organized with strong analytical skills.

Preferred:

  • Familiarity with clearing and settlement back-office systems (e.g., BETA) and investment banking analytics tools (e.g., ThomsonOne).
  • Experience using tools such as Azure DevOps, Figma, and Zeplin.
  • Knowledge or interest in software automated testing.
  • Background or internships in the financial services industry.

About Axos

Born digital-first, Axos delivers financial tools and services that allow individuals, small businesses, and companies to access and manage their money how, when, and where they want. We’re a diverse team of dynamic, insightful, and independent innovators who are excited to provide technology-driven solutions that offer unbeatable value to our customers.

Axos Financial is our holding company and is publicly traded on the New York Stock Exchange under the symbol "AX" (NYSE: AX).

Learn More about working at Axos Business Center

Pre-Employment Background Check, Medical, and Drug Test:

All offers are contingent upon the candidate successfully passing a credit check, criminal background check, and pre-employment medical and drug screening.

Equal Employment Opportunity:

Axos is an Equal Opportunity employer. We are committed to providing equal employment opportunities to all employees and applicants without regard to race, religious creed, color, sex (including pregnancy, breast feeding and related medical conditions), gender, gender identity, gender expression, sexual orientation, national origin, ancestry, citizenship status, military and veteran status, marital status, age, protected medical condition, genetic information, physical disability, mental disability, or any other protected status in accordance with all applicable federal, state, and local laws.

Job Functions and Work Environment:

While performing the duties of this position, the employee is required to sit for extended periods of time. Manual dexterity and coordination are required while operating standard office equipment such as computer keyboard and mouse, calculator, telephone, copiers, etc.

The work environment characteristics described here are representative of those an employee may encounter while performing the essential functions of this position. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions of this position.

title: Intern - Commercial
job_desc:
We are UMG, the Universal Music Group. We are the world’s leading music company. In everything we do, we are committed to artistry, innovation and entrepreneurship. We identify and develop recording artists and songwriters, and we produce, distribute and promote the most critically acclaimed and commercially successful music to delight and entertain fans around the world.

We are currently looking for Interns for our Commercial & Digital Strategy team.

The Commercial team has 3 verticals - Data Analytics, Digital, and D2C/E-Commerce. As a key support function, we play a crucial role in driving the organization's growth and success by aligning overall strategy with business objectives. With the primary goal of maximizing revenue generation, we provide strategic insights and solutions across various functions within the organization. We leverage data-driven insights, incorporation of direct-to-consumer (D2C) strategy, and optimization of digital tools across platforms (i.e. Spotify, Apple, Meta, TikTok, and YouTube) championing maximum support for our artists' releases and plans.

The Interns will assist in various projects within the 3 verticals of Commercial team and will collaborate with multiple departments on a daily basis.

How You'll CREATE

Data Analytics


  • Assist Data Scientist in curating data visualizations of track/artist performance, streams/views analysis, and consumer behavior across the music industry in PH
  • Search for viral posts that utilize priority tracks within social media and digital platforms for the PH domestic and international teams


Digital


  • Conduct market research and present case studies about the different digital marketing strategies by other music labels and across PH's music industry
  • Weekly monitoring of digital streaming platform charts and track placements in editorial playlists


E-Commerce


  • Assist D2C manager in ideation and mock-up creation for domestic releases


Desirable traits


  • Undergraduate on business, data science, marketing, operation management or related fields
  • High problem-solving skill and strong attribute in time & project management
  • Curiosity, passion for all things digital and strong team spirit
  • Ability to work well in a dynamic, fast-paced team environment while meeting critical deadlines
  • Knowledgeable in Microsoft Office, including Excel and PowerPoint, plus the ability to quickly learn and work with the new systems and software
  • Ability to create, analyze, and comprehend marketplace data and sales analytics for use in forecasting, production, and communication with others (optional)
  • Good verbal and written English communications skills
  • Have strong passion in music and eager to learn new systems
  • Passionate about music is a super plus


Interested? Please follow the link to submit your application today!

Note: Only shortlisted applicants will be contacted.

About us:

Universal Music Group (UMG) is the world leader in music-based entertainment, with a broad array of businesses engaged in recorded music, music publishing, merchandising and audiovisual content in more than 60 countries.

Featuring the most comprehensive catalog of recordings and songs across every musical genre, UMG identifies and develops artists and produces and distributes the most critically acclaimed and commercially successful music in the world. Committed to artistry, innovation and entrepreneurship, UMG fosters the development of services, platforms and business models in order to broaden artistic and commercial opportunities for our artists and create new experiences for fans.

UMG's catalog is marketed through two distinct divisions, Universal Music Enterprises (in the U.S.) and Universal Strategic Marketing (outside the U.S.). UMG also includes Universal Music Publishing Group, one of the industry's premier music publishing operations worldwide and Bravado, the leading provider of consumer, lifestyle and branding services to recording artists and entertainment brands around the world.

title: Software Engineer
job_desc:
Axos Business Center, Corp

About This Job

Axos Clearing is seeking a Software Engineer to support a variety of financial services, including equity and mutual fund trading, account management, and document generation. This role is essential in helping to build a large-scale system with a strong focus on microservices and system integrations. The ideal candidate should have experience with .NET Core, Go, or similar modern programming languages, and be eager to develop skills in managing complex microservices environments.

Responsibilities

  • Work closely with stakeholders and project leadership to implement and refine project requirements.
  • Contribute to the design and development of secure, high-performance, and scalable solutions.
  • Assist in building and maintaining microservices, integrating with external systems as needed.
  • Participate in agile ceremonies, contributing to sprint planning, reviews, and retrospectives.
  • Collaborate with team members to ensure high-quality, maintainable code.

Requirments:

  • Bachelor's degree in computer science, Engineering, or a related field, or equivalent training and experience.
  • 1-3 years of experience in professional software development.
  • Hands-on experience with Go, C# (.NET Core), or similar programming languages.
  • Basic familiarity with microservices architecture and RESTful APIs.
  • Experience working with NoSQL or relational databases.
  • Understanding of REST APIs.
  • Strong communication and teamwork abilities.
  • Problem-solving skills and attention to detail.
  • Eagerness to learn about emerging technologies and adapt to project requirements.

Preferred:

  • Familiarity with cloud platforms such as AWS, Azure, or Google Cloud Platform.
  • Familiarity with CI/CD tools (e.g., Jenkins, Azure DevOps, GitHub, GitLab CI).
  • Experience in containerization tools like Docker and orchestration platforms such as Kubernetes.
  • Knowledge or interest in infrastructure as code tools like Terraform or Ansible.
  • Knowledge or interest in software automated testing.
  • Knowledge of scripting experience with languages like Python, Shell, or PowerShell.
  • Experience or internships in the financial services industry.
  • Familiarity with "real-time" systems or trading platforms.

About Axos

Born digital-first, Axos delivers financial tools and services that allow individuals, small businesses, and companies to access and manage their money how, when, and where they want. We’re a diverse team of dynamic, insightful, and independent innovators who are excited to provide technology-driven solutions that offer unbeatable value to our customers.

Axos Financial is our holding company and is publicly traded on the New York Stock Exchange under the symbol "AX" (NYSE: AX).

Learn More about working at Axos Business Center

Pre-Employment Background Check, Medical, and Drug Test:

All offers are contingent upon the candidate successfully passing a credit check, criminal background check, and pre-employment medical and drug screening.

Equal Employment Opportunity:

Axos is an Equal Opportunity employer. We are committed to providing equal employment opportunities to all employees and applicants without regard to race, religious creed, color, sex (including pregnancy, breast feeding and related medical conditions), gender, gender identity, gender expression, sexual orientation, national origin, ancestry, citizenship status, military and veteran status, marital status, age, protected medical condition, genetic information, physical disability, mental disability, or any other protected status in accordance with all applicable federal, state, and local laws.

Job Functions and Work Environment:

While performing the duties of this position, the employee is required to sit for extended periods of time. Manual dexterity and coordination are required while operating standard office equipment such as computer keyboard and mouse, calculator, telephone, copiers, etc.

The work environment characteristics described here are representative of those an employee may encounter while performing the essential functions of this position. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions of this position.

title: Business Development Executive (Metro Manila)
job_desc:
“To be the most loved everyday food and groceries destination!” - that’s our mission at foodpanda (small ‘f’).


foodpanda is the largest food and grocery delivery platform in Asia, outside of China. Operating in more than 400 cities across 11 markets, we continue to expand and grow in our core food delivery business, as well as in new verticals like grocery deliveries, with a strong tech infrastructure at our core. From our restaurants-partners, cloud kitchens and cloud grocery stores — foodpanda is just one tap away, getting everything you need into your hands quickly and conveniently!


If you love working with technology to create solutions and are not afraid to roll up your sleeves to get things done, you will find your tribe here at foodpanda. foodpanda comprises of people from more than 60 nationalities, and we believe in winning through diversity.

foodpanda is part of the Delivery Hero Group, the world’s leading local delivery platform operating in 70+ countries worldwide


About The Opportunity

  • You will be part of our company’s growth by acquiring new businesses to partner with us
  • You will effectively and efficiently exhaust leads and close deals with target partners by cold calling, fieldwork, virtual presentations, etc.
  • Effectively and creatively present foodpanda’s packages to potential partners.
  • Work closely with other departments to make sure we have a successful vendor incubation.
  • Be the local representative in the area: monitor competitor activities, gather feedback, and provide recommendations to ensure a healthy market share.


What you need to be successful

  • Graduate of a Bachelor's degree in business, marketing, mass communication, or related areas are preferred
  • Open for fresh graduates with sales experience gained through internships, but candidates with 2-3 years sales and/or business development experience and strong understanding of Sales Pipeline Management will be prioritized
  • Strong communication skills. Preferably comfortable to speak in both English, Filipino, and in the local dialect in the area.
  • Open to do extensive fieldwork.
  • Highly motivated to achieve targets, objectives, and key result areas.
  • Self motivated team player with a proven ability work in a fast paced environment

title: Senior Talent Acquisition Specialist
job_desc:
Company Description
Work with Us. Change the World.
At AECOM, we're delivering a better world. Whether improving your commute, keeping the lights on, providing access to clean water, or transforming skylines, our work helps people and communities thrive. We are the world's trusted infrastructure consulting firm, partnering with clients to solve the world’s most complex challenges and build legacies for future generations.

There has never been a better time to be at AECOM. With accelerating infrastructure investment worldwide, our services are in great demand. We invite you to bring your bold ideas and big dreams and become part of a global team of over 50,000 planners, designers, engineers, scientists, digital innovators, program and construction managers and other professionals delivering projects that create a positive and tangible impact around the world.

We're one global team driven by our common purpose to deliver a better world. Join us.

Job Description
This role involves managing the entire recruitment process, ensuring that the agreed business demands are met annually. As part of a virtual, global team, the role will collaborate with AECOM's regional Talent Acquisition teams responsible for engaging and guiding all stakeholders through proactive, solution-focused approaches.

Responsibilities & Duties
End-to-End Recruitment:
  • Manage the full recruitment lifecycle for positions (internships, apprenticeships/cadetships, graduate roles), from job posting through onboarding. Requisitions may be high in volume and fast paced at certain times.
  • Build excellent relationships with hiring managers to define their recruitment needs and candidate profiles.
  • Create and execute innovative sourcing strategies to attract diverse early career talent.
  • Work with regional TA Managers, Senior TA Partners, and Hiring Managers to understand the workforce planning demand and requirements in each fiscal year.

Candidate Sourcing & Attraction:
  • Work in partnership with in-country TA teams to build upon existing strong relationships with universities, colleges, and industry bodies to create a sustainable pipeline of talent.
  • Leverage social media, job boards, LinkedIn, campus events, and career fairs to promote our brand and opportunities.
  • Implement the in-country TA Teams recruitment strategies and organise career fairs.

Candidate Experience:
  • Provide an exceptional candidate experience, from initial outreach to offer acceptance, and assist our Pre-Hire Support Team during on boarding.
  • Ensure candidates are processed swiftly and kept engaged and informed throughout the recruitment process.

Diversity and Inclusion Initiatives:
  • Understand our global and regional EDI (Diversity, Equity, and Inclusion) TA goals and ensure recruiting efforts support diverse hiring goals the covers full representation of the market
  • Deliver on specific EDI initiatives that encourage underrepresented talent to apply, ensuring a fair and inclusive recruitment process.

Assessment a Selection:
  • Become familiar with and oversee the delivery of the assessment process candidates; this includes screening questions, our situational judgement test, and business competency interviews based on selection criteria.
  • Coordinate and facilitate interviews, partnering with hiring managers to ensure the right cultural and skills fit.

Data Tracking & Reporting:
  • Maintain accurate records of candidates and recruitment metrics using Smart Recruiters Applicant Tracking Systems (ATS).
  • Provide regular updates to the team on progress, hiring targets, and key metrics.

Employer Branding:
  • Support the marketing and employer branding teams, and our in-country TA teams to enhance the company's employer brand on campuses and across digital channels, specifically in the candidate attraction phase This includes the use of content developed by in-country teams specifically for AECOM (careers site, brochures, and events postcards as examples).

General
  • Escalate issues and recommend resolutions to the Team Lead for timely resolution. May support junior members of the team in addressing routine issues within the assigned processes.
  • Maintain the SOP/DTP of current processes and incorporate documentation updates as required.
  • Perform moderately complex tasks in compliance with service level agreement, process, policies, and procedures.
  • Propose alternatives in identified issues and assist in investigating and in resolving common and unusual issues.
  • Identify areas for improvement to drive excellence in the end-to-end Early Careers recruitment and onboarding cycle.
  • Contribute specialized expertise to different assigned projects and may provide key updates to Team Lead and Manager.

Qualifications
Minimum Requirements
  • Bachelor’s degree, relevant experience or specific industry qualification in Marketing, HR or TA
  • At least 4 to 5 years of relevant professional experience in an Talent Acquisition as a full lifecycle recruiter preferably within a professional service, multinational consultancy.
  • Experience working in a fast-paced, high-volume recruitment environment is a plus.
  • Is familiar with a Global Business Services work environment that supports multiple global locations.
  • Experience of utilizing Applicant Tracking and Customer Relationship Management systems to their full potential while keeping data updated in real time.
  • Possess the experience, confidence, and presence to influence and engage internal stakeholders and the external market.

Attributes
  • Ability to effectively communicate and collaborate within a varied audience and internal and external customers. (Communication)
  • Ability to work in the best interests of the business whilst remaining ethical and compliant.
  • Ability to maintain good customer relationship with the ability to suggest ways to improve customer support customer experience (Customer Service)
  • Ability to be thorough and meticulous in completing assigned tasks and identifying errors, duplicates, & discrepancies through defined methods. (Attention to Detail)
  • Ability to identify and resolve simple to moderate with the ability to provide resolution alternatives by following defined policies and procedures. (Problem Solving)
  • Amenable to work in a hybrid work arrangement

Additional Information
About AECOM
AECOM is the world’s trusted infrastructure consulting firm, delivering professional services throughout the project lifecycle – from advisory, planning, design and engineering to program and construction management. On projects spanning transportation, buildings, water, new energy and the environment, our public- and private-sector clients trust us to solve their most complex challenges. Our teams are driven by a common purpose to deliver a better world through our unrivaled technical and digital expertise, a culture of equity, diversity and inclusion, and a commitment to environmental, social and governance priorities. AECOM is a Fortune 500 firm and its Professional Services business had revenue of $14.4 billion in fiscal year 2023. See how we are delivering sustainable legacies for generations to come at aecom.com and @AECOM.

Freedom to Grow in a World of Opportunity
You will have the flexibility you need to do your best work with hybrid work options. Whether you’re working from an AECOM office, remote location or at a client site, you will be working in a dynamic environment where your integrity, entrepreneurial spirit and pioneering mindset are championed.

You will help us foster a safe and respectful workplace, where we invite everyone to bring their whole selves to work using their unique talents, backgrounds and expertise to create transformational outcomes for our clients.

AECOM provides a wide array of compensation, benefits and well-being programs to meet the diverse needs of our employees and their families. We’re the world’s trusted global infrastructure firm, and we’re in this together – your growth and success are ours too.

Join us, and you’ll get all the benefits of being a part of a global, publicly traded firm – access to industry-leading technology and thinking and transformational work with big impact and work flexibility. As an Equal Opportunity Employer, we believe in each person’s potential, and we’ll help you reach yours.

All your information will be kept confidential according to EEO guidelines.
